title: protected Tweet settings overwritten by other settings

profile.name: Twitter
profile.about: Twitter helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
protected tweet settings will be disabled without the account owner's knowledge

## step for reproduction
1.Log in to an account with unprotected tweets on the Android app.
2. Log in to the same account on mobile.twitter.com and turn on protected tweets.
3. Confirm that the account's tweets are protected.
4. In the Android app, go to the NOTIFICATION the  click for ON
5. The account's tweets are now unprotected.

==I have deleted all data (stored data and cache), so you don't need to save any cache or history!==

## Impact

your tweet not protected
vulnerability_information_html:
protected tweet settings will be disabled without the account owner's knowledge

step for reproduction

1.Log in to an account with unprotected tweets on the Android app.

  1. Log in to the same account on mobile.twitter.com and turn on protected tweets.
  2. Confirm that the account's tweets are protected.
  3. In the Android app, go to the NOTIFICATION the click for ON
  4. The account's tweets are now unprotected.

I have deleted all data (stored data and cache), so you don't need to save any cache or history!

Impact

your tweet not protected

activities.message:
see my test video, I have recorded all steps.

==Don't say that the settings are not updated! If the settings is not updated, the padlock icon will not appear, but the video F543487 the padlock icon show in a account !!!==
activities.markdown_message:
see my test video, I have recorded all steps.

Don't say that the settings are not updated! If the settings is not updated, the padlock icon will not appear, but the video full_step (F543487) the padlock icon show in a account !!!

activities.message:
in my report this shows two different options and two impacts. see F543487
1. at 00.00 - 02.30 shows that "protected tweets" remain active when the notification settings (quality filter) are changed between On to Off
2. at 02.30 - 03.47 indicates that "protected tweet" is NOT active when notification settings (quality filter) are changed between Off to On

**appropriate reproduction steps in the video**

**step one**
1. Log in to an account with an unprotected tweet on the Android application
2. Enter the same account on mobile.twitter.com and turn on the protected tweet then confirm that the account tweet is protected.
3. In the Android application, open NOTICE (quality filter) click to ON (if the previous option is Off)

impact

1. Twitter account is not protected.


**step two**
1. Log in to an account with an unprotected tweet on the Android application
2. Enter the same account on mobile.twitter.com and turn on the protected tweet then confirm that the account tweet is protected.
3. In the Android application, open NOTICE (quality filter) click to OFF (if the previous option is On)

impact

1. Twitter account is still protected.
activities.markdown_message:
in my report this shows two different options and two impacts. see full_step (F543487)

  1. at 00.00 - 02.30 shows that "protected tweets" remain active when the notification settings (quality filter) are changed between On to Off
  2. at 02.30 - 03.47 indicates that "protected tweet" is NOT active when notification settings (quality filter) are changed between Off to On

appropriate reproduction steps in the video

step one

  1. Log in to an account with an unprotected tweet on the Android application
  2. Enter the same account on mobile.twitter.com and turn on the protected tweet then confirm that the account tweet is protected.
  3. In the Android application, open NOTICE (quality filter) click to ON (if the previous option is Off)

impact

  1. Twitter account is not protected.

step two

  1. Log in to an account with an unprotected tweet on the Android application
  2. Enter the same account on mobile.twitter.com and turn on the protected tweet then confirm that the account tweet is protected.
  3. In the Android application, open NOTICE (quality filter) click to OFF (if the previous option is On)

impact

  1. Twitter account is still protected.

activities.message:
Thank you for your report @jaka_tingkir,

We were able to reproduce the behavior you described, but it looks like this behavior is caused by quickly switching between `mobile.twitter.com` and Twitter's app. When we tested this issue, we could see the updated settings page, if we waited 5 minutes after changing our settings on  `mobile.twitter.com`. Can you reproduce this behavior if you wait 5 minutes after changing your settings on `mobile.twitter.com`? In addition, we noticed that your reproduction in F543487 video, shows the setting page with the correct "Protect my Tweet" settings. (2:22). Can you reproduce this behavior in each of your tests or does this attack occasionally fail to reproduce as demonstrated here F543487?

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for your report @jaka_tingkir,

We were able to reproduce the behavior you described, but it looks like this behavior is caused by quickly switching between mobile.twitter.com and Twitter's app. When we tested this issue, we could see the updated settings page, if we waited 5 minutes after changing our settings on mobile.twitter.com. Can you reproduce this behavior if you wait 5 minutes after changing your settings on mobile.twitter.com? In addition, we noticed that your reproduction in full_step (F543487) video, shows the setting page with the correct "Protect my Tweet" settings. (2:22). Can you reproduce this behavior in each of your tests or does this attack occasionally fail to reproduce as demonstrated here full_step (F543487)?

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.

@jaka_tingkir if you can break the fix in #519059 then create a new report detailing what you're able to do, just reference the previous report when you're explaining how you can bypass the fix. Whenever you have an issue that you believe is a valid security issue just create a new report.
